title: Role of Nutribiotics in Skin Care
content: The study of the human microbiome has been a hot topic during the last decades and more recently the skin microbiome has aroused great interest as well. So that, scientists have turned their attention to the role of the skin microbiome in skin health, and its relationship with different disorders as atopic dermatitis, psoriasis, acne, and rosacea, among others. Numerous studies and investigations have been performed to study the role of pre and probiotics as nutraceuticals in the treatment of skin diseases, with growing evidence along the last ten years. This review gathers information on the use of “nutribiotics” in skin care health, focus on the main dermatological diseases and other skin conditions. Clinical studies show that nutribiotics could be a new tool to improve skin health and pre, pro, syn, post and para-probiotics seem to be beneficial on several skin disorders, as well as repairing the skin barrier, or promoting wound healing. In conclusion, skin microbiome has emerged as a new field with high potential to develop disruptive solutions to manage skin health and disease. Future advances in this field may facilitate the treatment of skin dysbiosis being nutribiotics a suitable method for skin care.
